bibl.title: Writing, Teachers and Students in Graeco-Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: Diss. Columbia Univ. Summary in DA 54 (1993-1994) p. 509-A. - Study of how the writing of Greek was taught and learned, based on a new Catalogue of school exercises, which constitutes Appendix 1. Chapter 3 presents a prosopography of teachers in Graeco-Roman Egypt.
bibl.seg: CRIBIORE Raffaella, Writing, Teachers and Students in Graeco-Roman Egypt.

Diss. Columbia Univ. Summary in DA 54 (1993-1994) p. 509-A. - Study of how the writing of Greek was taught and learned, based on a new Catalogue of school exercises, which constitutes Appendix 1. Chapter 3 presents a prosopography of teachers in Graeco-Roman Egypt.
